title: 2024 US Presidential Primaries
text:
This dashboard aggregates data from the Meta Ad Library to show how citizens are targeted during the 2024 US Presidential Primaries.
    If you want to know more about Who Targets Me and our work on ad transparency, visit us on whotargets.me!
This section shows daily and total spending of political candidates in the run-up to the 2023-24 US Primaries election for the latest available data.

title: 🇺🇸 2024 US Primaries Dashboard
text:
Methodology
In collaboration with Who Targets Me, we monitored 23 political advertisers in United State during the 2024 US Presidential Primaries to better understand how campaigns use different targeting methods made available by Meta. To do this, we used data from the Meta Ad Library, using the new ‘Audience’ data which gives some detail on how pages target their ads.
To better understand the election, we kept only advertisers who:

Advertised in the last 7 days (Aug 12th - Aug 18th 2023)
Advertised in the last 30 days (Jul 20th - Aug 18th 2023)







Note



Meta only provides 7, 30 and 90 days windows for the targeting data in their Ad Library. Meta’s data also lags by a few days. Report will be updated as soon as new data is available.








Disclaimer



The data shown in this dashboard is based on the platform’s respective ad libraries which are known to be sometimes incomplete (Edelson et al. 2020; Silva et al. 2020). For this reason the data shown here might not reflect the full picture nor all political ads that were targeted at voters.




About the Creator of the Dashboard











Fabio Votta is a Ph.D. candidate in Political Communication at the University of Amsterdam who studies (online) political microtargeting and its usage around the world.











Want to see how political parties target you? Sign up at Who Targets Me and download the gratis browser plugin to see how parties on Facebook use your data:
https://whotargets.me/







Want to retrieve targeting data from the Facebook Ad Library yourself? This dashboard is powered by the R package: metatargetr. Check it out here:
https://github.com/favstats/metatargetr




Election Targeting Dashboards
A list of election dashboards:

🇳🇱 2021 Dutch parliamentary election (15th-17th March 2021)
🇩🇪 2021 German federal election (26 September 2021)
🇸🇪 2022 Swedish general election (11th September 2022)
🇺🇸 2022 United States midterm elections (8th November 2022)
🇺🇸 2022 United States midterm elections - Georgia Runoff (6th December 2022)
🇮🇹 2023 Lazio & Lombardy regional election (12-13th February 2023)
🇪🇪 2023 Estonian parliamentary election (5th March 2023)
🇳🇱 2023 Dutch provincial elections (15th March 2023)
🇲🇪 2023 Montenegrin presidential elections (19th March 2023) - 1st round
🇦🇺 2023 New South Wales state election (25th March 2023)
🇫🇮 2023 Finnish parliamentary election (2 April 2023)
🇹🇷 2023 Turkish general election (14 May 2023) - Round 1
🇩🇪 2023 Bremen State election (14 May 2023)
🇬🇷 2023 Greek Legislative election (21 May 2023)
🇹🇷 2023 Turkish Presidential election (14 May 2023) - Round 2
🇲🇪 2023 Montenegrin parliamentary elections (11 June 2023)
🇬🇷 2nd 2023 Greek Legislative election (25 May 2023)

title: 2023 Montenegrin legislative election
text:
Methodology
In collaboration with Who Targets Me, we monitored rread_lines(“n_advertisers.txt”)political advertisers in Montenegro during the 2023 Montenegrin legislative election to better understand how campaigns use different targeting methods made available by Meta. To do this, we used data from the Meta Ad Library, using the new ‘Audience’ data which gives some detail on how pages target their ads.
To better understand the election, we kept only advertisers who:

Advertised in the last 7 days (May 31st - Jun 6th 2023)
Advertised in the last 30 days (May 8th - Jun 6th 2023)


Note: Meta only provides 7, 30 and 90 days windows for the targeting data in their Ad Library. Meta’s data also lags by a few days. Report will be updated as soon as new data is available.



Election Targeting Dashboards
A list of election dashboards:

🇳🇱 2021 Dutch parliamentary election (15th-17th March 2021)
🇩🇪 2021 German federal election (26 September 2021)
🇸🇪 2022 Swedish general election (11th September 2022)
🇺🇸 2022 United States midterm elections (8th November 2022)
🇺🇸 2022 United States midterm elections - Georgia Runoff (6th December 2022)
🇮🇹 2023 Lazio & Lombardy regional election (12-13th February 2023)
🇪🇪 2023 Estonian parliamentary election (5th March 2023)
🇳🇱 2023 Dutch provincial elections (15th March 2023)
🇲🇪 2023 Montenegrin presidential elections (19th March 2023) - 1st round
🇦🇺 2023 New South Wales state election (25th March 2023)
🇫🇮 2023 Finnish parliamentary election (2 April 2023)
🇹🇷 2023 Turkish general election (14 May 2023) - Round 1
🇩🇪 2023 Bremen State election (14 May 2023)
🇬🇷 2023 Greek Legislative election (21 May 2023)
🇹🇷 2023 Turkish Presidential election (14 May 2023) - Round 2
🇲🇪 Montenegrin parliamentary elections, 2023 (11 June 2023)



About Us






Fabio Votta


Ph.D. candidate in Political Communication at the University of Amsterdam who studies (online) political microtargeting and its usage around the world.
Link





Who Targets Me


Grassroots activist group advocating for transparency in the digital age by monitoring political adverts on social media and their impact on democracy.
Link

title: Impressions
text:
Total Impressions

MinimumMaximum

title: 2023 Montenegrin Election Dashboard
text:
Over Time Impressions

MinimumMaximum

title: Impressions
text:
An impression is counted as the number of times an instance of an ad is on screen for the first time.
~Meta Business Help Center
The Facebook Ad library only provides very broad “lower” and “upper bounds” of impressions. The graphs below sum up the lower and upper bounds individually across all parties.

title: Impressions
text:
Impressions Over Time

MinimumMaximum

title: Impressions
text:
Impressions by Gender

The boxplots show the distribution of average audience shares per gender by advertiser.

For every ad, the Facebook ad library provides a “percentage” which relates to the share of men and women have that have seen the ad. So, the audience of an ad could show, for example, that 60% of the users that have seen the ad were women.

All at OncePer Party

title: Impressions
text:
Impressions by Age

The boxplots show the distribution of average audience shares per age group by advertiser.

For every ad, the Facebook ad library provides a “percentage” which relates to the share of the specific demographic that has seen the ad. So, the audience of an ad could show, for example, that 60% of the users that have seen the ad were between 18-24
You can try to remove/add individual age groups to better understand the graph

All at OncePer Party

title: Impressions
text:
Potential Reach






Facebook says about this metric:

This is an estimate of the size of the audience that’s eligible to see this ad. It’s based on targeting criteria, ad placements and how many people were shown ads on Facebook apps and services in the past 30 days. ~Meta Business Help Center

Based on that, we can assume that a higher potential reach means that a party was trying to target a broader range of citizen whereas a lower potential reach means the party was engaging in more microtargeting. The boxplots show the distribution of average minimum potential reach by advertiser.

title: Targeting
text: This section shows spening per targeting criteria used by political candidates to reach citizens in the run-up to the 2024 US Presidential Primaries for the latest available data.

title: Targeting
text:
Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

1 + 1

[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


[1] 4


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

title: Targeting
text:
Spending per Targeting Criteria
How much did campaigns spend on different targeting methods? The graphs below show spending overall across all candidates and by candidate.

Note: targeting criteria can overlap so the percentages do not sum up to 100%.


Jul 21st - Aug 19th 2023 (Last 30 days)Aug 13th - Aug 19th 2023 (Last 7 days)



OverallBy Candidate








































































































OverallBy Candidate

title: Targeting
text:
Top Targeted (Detailed) Audiences
Here, we show the top targeted audiences for each Candidate for the “detailed” targeting that Meta offers (ranked by amount of Euro spend). Most (but not all) of these audiences are “interest” audiences, i.e. the candidates targeted people interested in “Books” or “Politics”.

Jul 21st - Aug 19th 2023 (Last 30 days)Aug 13th - Aug 19th 2023 (Last 7 days)

title: Targeting
text:
Top Contested Audiences
Here, we show the top most contested audiences, i.e. where all candidates have spent considerable amounts of money competing to reach voters with the same interests.

Jul 21st - Aug 19th 2023 (Last 30 days)Aug 13th - Aug 19th 2023 (Last 7 days)

title: Targeting
text:
Geographical Targeting
The graphs below show various kinds of location targeting that candidates engaged in on Meta platforms. The bigger the area the more money was spend by the Candidate on targeting this location.

Jul 21st - Aug 19th 2023 (Last 30 days)



RegionsCities

title: Targeting
text:
Geographical Exclusion
On Meta, political candidates can also exclude certain geographical units. The graphs below show which locations were excluded from seeing political advertisements and how much money the candidates spend on these ads. The bigger the area the more money was spend on ads excluding this location.

Jul 21st - Aug 19th 2023 (Last 30 days)




Cities

title: Targeting
text:
Age Targeting
The graphs below show targeting by age groups and how much percentage of Candidate budgets were spent on them.

Note: targeting criteria can overlap so the percentages do not sum up to 100%.


Jul 21st - Aug 19th 2023 (Last 30 days)Aug 13th - Aug 19th 2023 (Last 7 days)

title: Targeting
text:

Note: targeting criteria can overlap so the percentages do not sum up to 100%.

title: Targeting
text:

The graphs below show targeting by job (sectors) and how much percentage of Candidate budgets were spent on them.

Note: targeting criteria can overlap so the percentages do not sum up to 100%.


Jul 21st - Aug 19th 2023 (Last 30 days)
